results.title: ‘Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery’ Review: Another Clue for You All
results.abstract: Daniel Craig returns as the world’s greatest detective, facing down a blue-chip cast of possible murderers in Rian Johnson’s new whodunit.
des_facet: Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Daniel Craig returns as the detective Benoit Blanc in “Glass Onion,” Rian Johnson’s sequel to his hit murder mystery, “Knives Out.”
Daniel Craig returns as the detective Benoit Blanc in “Glass Onion,” Rian Johnson’s sequel to his hit murder mystery, “Knives Out.”

results.title: Jeremy Pope Is Telling Himself ‘Yes’
results.abstract: As the Tony-nominated actor segues to the big screen in the gay military drama “The Inspection,” he reflects on years of shame and learning to accept himself.

multimedia.caption: Pope said the tan suit informed his energy, “like, ‘You’re going to be strong, you’re going to be swag, you’re going to be sexy, and it’s OK for you to be that version of yourself today.’”
multimedia.copyright: Erik Carter for The New York Times

results.title: This Mars Documentary Required Many Sols
results.abstract: “Good Night Oppy” chronicles the work and passion of the scientists who shepherded the Mars rover program.

multimedia.caption: The filmmakers sifted through nearly 1,000 hours of footage from NASA.
The filmmakers sifted through nearly 1,000 hours of footage from NASA.

results.title: Michael J. Fox, Diane Warren and Cher at the Raucous Governors Awards
results.abstract: The actor and songwriter, along with Euzhan Palcy and Peter Weir, received honorary Oscars as current contenders like Jennifer Lawrence worked the crowd.

multimedia.caption: Michael J. Fox received the Jean Hersholt Humanitarian Award from Woody Harrelson.

results.title: In ‘There There,’ the Actors in the Room Are Far Far From Each Other
results.abstract: Andrew Bujalski set the rules for the ultimate pandemic film: No one could be in the same location. That wound up including the cinematographer and director.

multimedia.caption: Lennie James in “There There.” He appears opposite Lili Taylor, though they were never in the same room.
Lennie James in “There There.” He appears opposite Lili Taylor, though they were never in the same room.

results.title: Five International Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: This month’s picks include a Bollywood murder mystery, an elliptical Portuguese documentary, a Chinese drama about gay hustlers and more.

results.title: ‘She Said’ Filmmakers and Weinstein Victims: An Emotional Collaboration
results.abstract: Though the drama avoids showing assaults or even much of the producer, a survivor likened reliving the experience to “watching your own car crash.”

multimedia.caption: The director Maria Schrader chose not to include scenes of Harvey Weinstein’s attacks: “I do not need to add another rape scene to the world.”

results.title: Sheriff’s Report on ‘Rust’ Shooting Doesn’t Find Source of Live Rounds
results.abstract: A central question in the death of the film’s cinematographer was unanswered in the report delivered to prosecutors, who previously indicated that up to four people could be charged.
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Graham Bowley

multimedia.caption: The cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was killed and the director Joel Souza wounded during the filming of “Rust” last year.
The cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was killed and the director Joel Souza wounded during the filming of “Rust” last year.

results.title: Tenoch Huerta Mejía and the Beauty of Representation in ‘Wakanda Forever’
results.abstract: The Mexican actor’s breakthrough moment playing Namor in the “Black Panther” sequel is especially gratifying for the antiracism activist.

multimedia.caption: Huerta has taken a lot of flak on social media for his antiracism comments, but he’s not deterred: “Do you think those comments have stopped me?”
multimedia.copyright: Elliott Jerome Brown Jr. for The New York Times

results.title: ‘Leonor Will Never Die’ Review: Rewriting Life, One Scene at a Time
results.abstract: A comatose genre director in the Philippines becomes trapped in one of her own screenplays in this messily inventive debut feature.

multimedia.caption: Sheila Francisco in “Leonor Will Never Die.”
Sheila Francisco in “Leonor Will Never Die.”
Sheila Francisco in “Leonor Will Never Die.”

results.title: Hail to the Queen: Angela Bassett on ‘Black Panther: Wakanda Forever’
results.abstract: The veteran star of “What’s Love Got to Do With It” and “Waiting to Exhale” tried to talk the director, Ryan Coogler, out of a plot twist in the Marvel sequel.

multimedia.caption: “I don’t know, as an actor, what comic-book acting might look like,” said Angela Bassett, adding, “We treat it like life, like it’s happening.”
“I don’t know, as an actor, what comic-book acting might look like,” said Angela Bassett, adding, “We treat it like life, like it’s happening.”
“I don’t know, as an actor, what comic-book acting might look like,” said Angela Bassett, adding, “We treat it like life, like it’s happening.”

results.title: Buffy Sainte-Marie Broke Boundaries in Folk. A Documentary Tells Her Story.
results.abstract: She brought attention to Indigenous issues in her music, and was the first Indigenous person to win an Oscar. “Buffy Sainte-Marie: Carry It On” makes the case for her continued importance.

multimedia.caption: “It wasn’t about careerism at all,” Buffy Sainte-Marie said. “I wanted to write songs that would last for generations.”
multimedia.copyright: Akasha Rabut for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: “It wasn’t about careerism at all,” Buffy Sainte-Marie said. “I wanted to write songs that would last for generations.”

results.title: Adorning ‘Black Panther: Wakanda Forever’
results.abstract: Ruth E. Carter, the Oscar-winning costume and jewelry designer, said her team was inspired by Mayan culture.

multimedia.caption: In “Black Panther: Wakanda Forever,” Mayan motifs inspired the jewelry designs for the Talocan tribe. Here, Namor, the Talocan leader, played by Tenoch Huerta Mejía, and his cousin, played by Mabel Cadena.

results.title: Title Search: Can You Find 15 Spy Novels Hiding in Plain Sight?
results.abstract: Espionage-themed novels have been thrilling readers for decades and here’s a chance to test your knowledge of the genre.

results.title: The Charming Star With Soulful Eyes Happens to Be a Donkey
results.abstract: The “EO” filmmakers wanted to tell their story via a silent animal but felt dogs or cats were clichéd. Their choice turned out to be anything but stubborn.

multimedia.caption: Tako was one of six donkeys sharing the title role in “EO.”
Tako was one of six donkeys sharing the title role in “EO.”
Tako was one of six donkeys sharing the title role in “EO.”

results.title: Words Were Once His Harshest Weapon. Now He Carries an AK-47.
results.abstract: Anton Filatov, a Ukrainian film critic, was pulled into a theater he never expected to enter: the front lines of war, where he now writes of the scene in the trenches instead of what’s onscreen.
results.byline: By Jeffrey Gettleman and Oleksandra Mykolyshyn

multimedia.caption: Anton Filatov, left, a Ukrainian film critic turned soldier, in an abandoned house near the front in Donbas in August. He has kept writing throughout the war, though his subject has changed.
multimedia.copyright: Jim Huylebroek for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Anton Filatov, left, a Ukrainian film critic turned soldier, in an abandoned house near the front in Donbas in August. He has kept writing throughout the war, though his subject has changed.

results.title: ‘The Menu’ Serves Fine Dining on a Skewer
results.abstract: A look at how the creators of the new satirical film took the already high-pressure world of elite restaurants to a thrilling and terrifying level.

multimedia.caption: Ralph Fiennes, as the tormented chef Julian Slowik, wrote a key speech about s’mores that parodies the language of haute cuisine.

results.title: ‘EO’ Review: Imagining the Lives of Other Creatures
results.abstract: The titular character of this fantastic adventure is no Disneyfied, cutesy creature. The director Jerzy Skolimowski emphasizes his animality and un-knowableness.

multimedia.caption: This wild, boldly expressionistic movie conveys the life of its largely silent protagonist, EO the donkey, with a bare minimum of dialogue.
This wild, boldly expressionistic movie conveys the life of its largely silent protagonist, EO the donkey, with a bare minimum of dialogue.
